Description: Small lid of a stone vessel made of white limestone. Parts of the lip are broken off. The upper and underside are flat and well smoothed, the lip is 0.5 cm wider on both sides than the base. There is a well defined ridge. The top is decorated with a floral depiction drawn in black lines, very faded but still recognisable.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 173)
Aston 1996 / Egyptian Pottery of the Late New Kingdom and Third Intermediate Period (12th - 7th Centuries BC) - Tentative Footsteps into Forbidden Terrain (p. 154)
